5569465,2017-02-25T00:40:32Z,2017-02-25T01:13:10Z,Version 0.15.0.671,- Add the ability to change how field names are converted (if at all).  By default it should convert them as it is currently, with camelCase field names using `CamelCaseFieldNameConverter`.  This can be changed by setting the `FieldNameConverter` property in the execution configuration.

- Because of the previous use of `CamelCasePropertyNamesContractResolver`, Aliases would get converted to camelCase.  Aliases now do not get converted and will be returned exactly as they are requested.
- Note: You can write your own `IFieldNameConverter` - keep in mind that some field names, such as those used by introspection, need to remain camelCase for tools like GraphiQL to work.

,https://api.github.com/users/joemcbride,255007,joemcbride,https://api.github.com/repos/graphql-dotnet/graphql-dotnet/releases/5569465/assets,https://api.github.com/repos/graphql-dotnet/graphql-dotnet/releases/5569465,master,https://api.github.com/repos/graphql-dotnet/graphql-dotnet/tarball/v0.15.0.671,https://github.com/graphql-dotnet/graphql-dotnet/releases/tag/v0.15.0.671,https://api.github.com/repos/graphql-dotnet/graphql-dotnet/zipball/v0.15.0.671,v0.15.0.671,False,False

4800760,2016-11-30T23:36:01Z,2016-11-30T23:55:13Z,Version 0.14.0.633,Major release with lots of features and updates!  Thanks to @tlil87 @jquense @dNetGuru @dlukez for their contributions.
- Documentation!  There is now some basic documentation [available here](https://github.com/graphql-dotnet/graphql-dotnet/tree/master/docs)

- The preferred way to configure the execution engine has changed.  Please use the configuration action or the `ExecutionParameters` overloads for `ExecuteAsync`.  The old `ExecuteAsync` with a ton of optional parameters will be deprecated in a future release.
var schema = new Schema { Query = new StarWarsQuery() }
- The core engine now supports both Type based and Instance based registration
- Add Metadata dictionaries to fields and objects
- Basic Metrics are now being tracked and field level metrics can be enabled with the new `InstrumentFieldsMiddleware` field middleware
- Fix bug when trying to register an interface type on `ObjectGraphType<T>`
- Fix issue where an already faulted task would attempt to be awaited
- Fix bug when trying to register an Interface
- Add support for `float` and `decimal` for property expressions

3990347,2016-08-27T18:09:42Z,2016-08-27T18:12:41Z,Version 0.11.0.493,- A few minor updates to introspection
- The language AST types have been moved from `GraphQL.Language` to `GraphQL.Language.AST`.

- This release adds a new lexer and parser for the GraphQL language.  The AntlrDocumentBuilder is now deprecated in favor of the GraphQLDocumentBuilder.  This new lexer and parser are written in C# and have no other dependencies.  It is also slightly faster than the AntlrDocumentBuilder.  The AntlrDocumentBuilder will be removed in the next major release.
- The new parser can be found at [graphql-dotnet/parser](http://github.com/graphql-dotnet/parser).

3414003,2016-06-10T00:13:31Z,2016-06-10T00:12:55Z,Version 0.8.2,- Fixes a bug with EnumerationGraphType and input variables
- Fixes a bug where float values would not be created
- Add overload to DocumentExecutor where validation rules can be
- Refactor ToObject to support enums, guids, nullable lists, and
- Add overload to QueryArguments which takes params
See the [v0.8.0 upgrade guide](http://github.com/graphql-dotnet/graphql-dotnet/blob/master/upgrade-guides/v0.8.0.md) for more information.
- The core language has been revamed to provide additional metadata such as line numbers and AST types.
- Coerce on Scalar types has been replaced by parseValue, parseLiteral, and serialize.
- Several fixes around the use of enums.
- The following validation rules have been added:

3372293,2016-06-04T00:17:51Z,2016-06-04T00:18:01Z,Version 0.7.1,- Add RegisterType and AdditionalTypes to ISchema
- Change how ExecutionResult is serialized, which should now conform to the spec with a lowercase ""message""
- The core language has been revamed to provide additional metadata such as line numbers and AST types.
- Coerce on Scalar types has been replaced by parseValue, parseLiteral, and serialize.
- Several fixes around the use of enums.
These language updates should allow the Validation feature to be completed.

2870086,2016-03-23T06:58:16Z,2016-03-23T07:15:47Z,Version 0.6.2,Adds `SchemaPrinter` which prints the shorthand schema syntax for a given schema.
You can also print the shorthand for introspection.
- `GetArgument()` wasn't using the `FieldDefinition`'s default value for an argument correctly. Added method signature for using the `FieldDefinition` default, and one for overriding the value

- `ConnectionType<T>`, `EdgeType<T>` and `PageInfoType` implementations have been separated from their backing data objects. Improved and more consistent Relay-specific helper functions for these will be transitioned over to graphql-dotnet/conventions
- Moved Relay-specific type structures to the `GraphQL.Types.Relay` namespace
- Removed `new()` constraint on connections and edges
- Exposing `ResolveFieldContext` in `FieldBuilder` and `ConnectionBuilder` (and consequently also the `CancellationToken`, etc.)
- Added support for deprecation of `EnumerationGraphType` members
- Added a range of unit tests for the above
- `IntGraphType.Coerce()` can now also deal with `long` integers
- `GraphQLAbstractType` now has a `PossibleTypes` property which is a list of graph types of all possible types that abstract type could be.
- The `PossibleTypes` collection is populated on bootstrap of the Schema.

`IsTypeOf` allows you to replace usages of `ResolveType`.  It allows you to place the type check within the specific object graph type.  This makes it so each interface or union type does not need to have a specific check for each of their possible types.
public NamedType(DogType dogType, CatType catType, PersonType personType)
- Add GraphQLAbstractType which both interface and union types inherit from
- CHANGE: only return field if source object contains that field
- CHANGE: Return null instead of an empty list when introspecting (to match the spec) - fields, interfaces, enums, input values
- CHANGE: GraphType now implements Equals, based on the Name of the type
- Fix: Ensure fragments are only visited once during an execution path
- Fix bug with input objects and variables

1726486,2015-08-26T16:38:36Z,2015-08-26T16:42:24Z,Version 0.3.0,- BREAKING CHANGE: The way field registration works has changed. Only `Field<T>` registration is now supported.  This was to support introspection.
- Antrl/JSON.NET types are now marked as internal.
- Added the ability to specifiy a root object
- Added interfaces IDocumentExecuter, IDocumentBuilder, IDocumentWriter, IDocumentValidation
- Changed DocumentWriter to default to unformatted JSON
- Added objects as inputs and fixed some issues with inputs as variables
